top_comment.text:
Swimming with dolphins should be banned. It is stressful to dolphins and 
those who do not understand their actual body language assume that they are 
enjoying themselves. Dolphins don't have control over their facial 
expressions as we do; even a dolphin in agony may appear to be 'smiling'. I 
would encourage everyone not to swim with dolphins, or visit the 
notoriously cruel SeaWorld for that matter.﻿

top_comment.text: Who's the black kid?﻿
top_comment.author: Meg Liz

comments.text: You should've been done awhile ago. Have a nice day.
comments.author: Meg Liz

comments.text:
Well, I think we all get annoyed when little kids like yourself think 
they're right about everything. Agreed?
comments.author: Meg Liz

comments.text:
Listen bitch, it's not racist! The child is black! I didn't say there was a 
problem with that. Sorry if I didn't word my question to your liking, but I 
am not here to please you! I'm well aware this is 2014, too. Now go do your 
English homework. Your grammar needs serious work.
comments.author: Meg Liz

comments.text:
I did not insult anyone's little sister. Nothing I said was an insult in 
anyway. You need to figure out the difference between a question and an 
insult. I don't need some PMSing little crap to tell me what's rude and 
what isn't, either. I'm guessing you're smart enough to know that the world 
is not your ice cream cone and not everything will always go your way. 
Sometimes you just need to deal with it.
comments.author: Meg Liz

comments.text:
Lol, okay fine. Look at my comments but there isn't any reason to give me 
crap about it. If you aren't interested in my opinions, you shouldn't say 
anything. I was merely asking a question, and you called me rude because of 
it. I wasn't the one who started this argument.
comments.author: Meg Liz

comments.text:
I was not picking a fight with you, just so you know. Thanks for stalking 
my comments and now maybe you should move on with your life. ;)
comments.author: Meg Liz

comments.text:
Bitch, I am not being rude. I only wanted to know who she was. And quite 
frankly, I don't care if you think I'm rude. So, only comment on my post if 
you're planning to answer my question. Thanks.
comments.author: Meg Liz

captions.text:
It's Brooklyn and Bailey,
and today our video

is going to be about
the cruise that we just

finished going on
for spring break.

-It was our very, very
first cruise ever.
-And it was a ton of fun of fun.

-Like, the best seven
days of my life.

-Yeah, so the shops we went to,
like the places we stopped at--

They were like green everywhere,
and the water is beautiful.

And because we
live in Texas, it's
But if was amazing, all of them.

And then what we did in-- let
me think-- (BOTH) Cozumel.
We went to this big ocean.

So it was like
this ocean resort--
So we went to this beach.

And we, like, it
had inflatables.

And they had them
out on the water.

And you would like
swim out to them--
-And then climb on all of them.

-Yeah, so that was
what we did in Cozumel.

-Then in Belize, we
went cave tubing.

Like, cave tubing, I'm like
what the heck is cave tubing,

---in this group, you go up
like this little mountain.

And you're climbing
in the jungle trail.

And you like, we had
this guy with us.

-Anyways, it was a
guide, and he was Mayan.

And so he was showing us all
of the old Mayan traditions
to do in the jungle and stuff.

-I mean, the
coolest thing he did

was he's showed us how
you can take these soldier
ants, which are like this big.

He stomped on the whole
nest, and he took one.

-And he goes, this is how Mayans
stitch up their, like, wounds.

-Then he stuck it, and
he let it bite him,
and then he pulled off the body.

-And then he took it off
his body, and it just--

-And then he pulled
on it, and the head
was like stuck to his arm.

And then the rest
of it was gone.

So it was just staying
there, like pinching his arm,

and that held the
wound together.

And then also, another
thing we did was--

We ate termites, and they
tasted like (BOTH) mints.

I mean, it was like
chewing on a crunchy mint.
It was actually kind of fun.
-He put his hand in the tree.

-I took it from the nest
and put it in my mouth.

-And then he just picked
one off, and [MOUTH SMACKS],

-Anyways, after all the
adventures in the jungle,

you get to this cave
with water in it.

And there's a river
going through the cave

So you get in your
little inflatable tubes.

And you get tied together and
stuff, so you don't get lost.

-And then you just start
going through this cave.

And they show you all the
stalagmites, and (BOTH)

stalactites, and all the
pretty crystals, and the bats.

-And then my dad's
tube, funny enough--

-He popped it in the
middle of the ride.

And then we went and had some
yummy Mexican food and stuff.

-And then the next stop
was Roatan, Honduras.

And then we went
zip lining there.

The water's so clear, and
it's like green and hilly,

All you could see from the
cafe windows was green.

-Oh, and then so
we went zip lining.

And then you would go on
these like 16 or 17 (BOTH)

like zip lines all
through the jungle.

-Yeah, so did I.
And then at the end,

you went back to
the little like, I
-And we got to hold a monkey.

-And he was like
crawling all over.

Like, you never get to hold a
monkey, and he was just like--

-He would try to like take
your sunglasses off your head

-They're like, they
like to take stuff.

-Yeah, so we got to hold that
monkey, which was adorable.

And then after that, we
went to the Beach Taviana.

And it was the most perfect
beach I've ever been on.

Like, you could walk out like
so far out to ocean and still,

-It's like see
through water, so you

can see all the
way to the bottom.

-And then the sand was
like walking on cotton.

-Yeah, the sand-- they had
like combed all the rocks
and all that other stuff out.

-So we were just like walking
on cotton all the way out.

-So all it was like soft sand
all the way out to the ocean.
And it was the perfect weather.

-And then last but not
least was Costa Maya.

And Costa Maya was-- we
went dolphins swimming.

So we got to go
swimming with dolphins.
We got to kiss a dolphin.

And they took us in this
tank with like four dolphins,

-And we got to
hold onto the fins,

and the dolphins would
swim around with us.
And then we got to kiss them.

We got to make them
do a little dancing.

But yeah, so that's what
we did on all of our stops.

And then we-- well,
on the ship, we'll

tell you a little
bit of the ship.

We had this thing
called (BOTH) teen club.
-And we kind of just hung out.

-You know, teen club sounds
like, oh, teen club, you know?
But this was like teen club.

It was so good, because
there were so many nice kids

And we just wandered
around the boat.

And they had non-stop
food, so you could just

-I swear I had ice
cream every 30 minutes.
You get it whenever you want.

And you had a choice of
rainbow sprinkles or chocolate,

They also had like
a reoccurring--

or not like a reoccurring-- but
they had a show every night.

And one of them
was a magician guy.
Or no, there was like a circus.

The little kids actually put
on a circus at one point.

-And they had all
of the little--

And they had their
little kid club.
-They were in a little kid club.

-That you would go hang out
the kids that are your age.

-And so Sweetpea, our little
sister, was dressed as a tiger,

because they had like
a theme for the circus.

-Along with all the other
little ones, and it was so cute.

-And then the all got
to do tricks and stuff,
like a couple at a time.

-So I bet you're wondering if
we got recognized on the ship,

because I know we must have
said something about it,

and lots of you guys said
you were either on the ship

or knew someone on
the ship that knew us.

So yes, we did get recognized
several times, at least 10,

We got lots of
pictures with people.

We were on beach and
people recognized us,

-From like other cruise ships,
they saw us and recognized us.

-And we were even--
where were we?

And I got my hair
corn rowed, in braid.

-The Belizian people that
were braiding my hair

They said they took classes
and figured out how to braid.

And so they were getting
all this advice from my mom,

like how to do new
braids and stuff.

-It was such a
fun trip, and so--
I wish we were still on it.

-Now we have to
go back to school.

-Next spring break,
mom and dad, let's go.

Thank you guys so
much for watching.

Also, we hope you enjoyed
our recap of our cruise.

I hope you guys felt
like you were with us,

because I feel like we're
all family or friends.

And we should all be
on a cruise together.

-That would be so
cool, oh my gosh.

-Don't forget to follow us on
Instagram @BrooklynAndBailey.

Also, leave a comment below on
which adventure you would go on

or which one you
thought worked the best.

-Yeah, which one you
thought was the coolest

-Yeah and I guess we'll
see you guys later.

-And if you don't want to
fill it as high we did,

you can always stuff the
cone with tissue paper.

Or you could pour in a
little bit less M&M's.

title: Spring Break with Twins Brooklyn and Bailey
